definition: cave/hole/zero (unambiguous spoken form when spelling out numbers)/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Seepage flow can be observed in stalactite caves.
sentences.chinese: 在鐘乳石溶洞裏，可以見到滲流現象。

sentences.english: Karst cave if found any is filled up or contained with water.
sentences.chinese: 在業已發現的卡斯特溶洞中均充滿或含有水。

sentences.english: Is located 4 kilometers west of the city Luanchuan, is a natural limestone cave.
sentences.chinese: 位於欒川縣城以西4公里處，是一座天然石灰岩溶洞。

sentences.english: This invention presents a making technique of artificial cavern and karst landform.
sentences.chinese: 本發明是一種人造溶洞及岩溶地貌製作工藝。

sentences.english: On the way to the cave.
This natural limestone cave is called the "Cave for the Mountain God".
sentences.chinese: 這個天然形成的溶洞被稱爲“山神洞”。

sentences.english: Lights illuminate the Thurston Lava Tube in the Hawaii Volcanoes National Park.
sentences.chinese: 燈光照亮了位於夏威夷火山國家公園的瑟斯頓岩溶洞。

sentences.english: We would never have found this cave.
sentences.chinese: 如果沒有他們，我們找不到這個溶洞的。

sentences.english: The experiences for forecasting covered karst cave are accumulated.
sentences.chinese: 從而爲隱伏溶洞的預測積累了經驗。

definition: great valley/Grand Canyon of Colorado River
karst landform (weathered limestone, often forming caves)
Stone Forest, notable set of limestone formations in Yunnan
